what: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
title: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
text: goal blaseRtemplates provide skeleton project setup based usethis package. usethis great expand idea provide additional R scripts always useful project. package provides helpers working git via R. may helpful new users convenient experienced users. workflow provided git_commands.R aims minimize avoid conflicts, working terminal may still necessary complicated situations. New versions 0.0.0.0125 onward implemented new cache structure. cacheing approach similar renv. However system reconciliation versions much straightforward. addition, default starting new project, automatically latest versions packages available . project-specific libraries symlinked main cache save disk space. See minimal examples

title: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
text: Edit .Renvironment file set blaseRtemplates cache. system administrator, edit Renviron.site file: set blaseRtemplates cache folder tell pak cache source files. run: Restart R.
code: BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT=<a convenient directory> R_PKG_CACHE_DIR=<same as BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT>/pkgcache dir.create(file.path(<same as BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT>, "library"))

title: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
text: install single package: can find human-readable table packages cache BLASERTEMPLATES_CACHE_ROOT/package_catalog.tsv. Use trick install long list packages may using: code install list packages capture error messages fail install. Uninstalled give package names. likley going base packages distributed CRAN don’t need cahce packages non-standard repositories local source files install manually.
code: # install a new package or get the latest version from a repository  blaseRtemplates::install_one_package(package = "<package_name>", how = "new_or_update")  # get a fresh link to the newest version available in the cache  blaseRtemplates::install_one_package(package = "<package_name>", how = "link_from_cache")  # get a specific version in the cache  blaseRtemplates::install_one_package(package = "<package_name>", how = "link_from_cache", which_version = "1.0.0.") packages_to_install <- c(<vector of package names>)  safely_install <- purrr::safely(blaseRtemplates::install_one_package)    installation <- purrr::map(   .x = packages_to_install,   .f = \(x) safely_install(x, how = "new_or_update")   )  transposed_installation <- purrr::transpose(installation)  uninstalled <- purrr::map2_chr(.x = transposed_installation$error,             .y = packages_to_install,             .f = \(x, y) {               if (!is.null(x)) {                 return(y)               } else {                 return("ok")               }             } ) uninstalled <- uninstalled[uninstalled != "ok"]

title: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
text: can use function replace entire project library new one. default, function install newest version available. generate new project library catalog. tsv file lives within project. indicates available actively used packages, based library() package:: calls R code. file meant tracked git can provide version control reproducibility packages used project. Say, however, collaborating project. Another person may using different set packages. can circumstances change output. adopt package library used different individual, supply argument get_new_library(). files created structured way; files always named _.tsv. Therefore never cause git conflicts. can use simple anti_join preview differences two project library catalogs.
code: blaseRtemplates::get_new_library() blaseRtemplates::get_new_library("other_user_projet.tsv") my_lib <- readr::read_tsv() their_lib <- readr::read_tsv() anti_join(my_lib, their_lib, by = c("name", "version")))

title: Generates a structured R project with custom templates.
text: BlaseRtemplates handles project data slightly differnt way regular packages. Run function install, update, load package data: function: Goes supplied directory. Checks latest version package according standard version numbering scheme. Compares version installed version cache project library. Updates cache /project library newest version necessary. specific version data package supplied, e.g. *1.0.1.tar.gz, install load one. allows installation old versions data. Note however, may faster case install cache present using install_one_package(). Loads package hidden environment pointer, loaded memory called. function executed together library calls project. See dependencies.R.

Easily Install Packages — easy_install
text: Typically like use existing copies packages renv cache, rather taking time re-download rebuild .  can specify option = "link_from_cache".  Providing package name install latest available version.  Providing package @1.2.3" install package version 1.2.3.  Providing package#hash install unique version package, identified hash.  can get package hash list get_cache_binary_pkg_catalog(). Alternatively may want install new package update package CRAN, bioconductor another repository.  Specify "new_or_update". installing local packages tarball files, "" ignored, option "tarball" completeness.  "tarball" selected package tarball, message effect returned.

text: package Package wish install.  "package name" attempt install CRAN.  "bioc::package_name" attempt install bioconductor.  "github repo owner/package" attempt install github.  Providing file path tarball(.tar.gz) move package source cache attempt install . installation method.  nothing chosen default "ask", Default: c("ask", "new_or_update", "link_from_cache", "tarball")
